data.text: @skooks We’re still averaging about 1,900 dead people per day, but this has been going on sooo long we’re just tired of it and ready to say, yeah, 1,900 dead people per day is acceptable if we can just get back to “normal.”
@RunBayou79 @skooks We can. Or at least long enough.  We just won't.  And it says a lot about our national identity.
@skooks In other words, I can support your right to choose to disagree with me that doesn't mean I think you're right.

@skooks If it helps, masks (outside of KN95s) don't do squat against omicron.  This is all for show.

You are no more or less safe today than you will be tomorrow when the mask rules go away.

@skooks That's still not saying that she's suggesting we do the same.
It's unbelievable how you're twisting this.
@dansoto She says in the article that she herself will continue wearing a mask in most indoor settings

@skooks Again, you are misreading the quote. She is NOT suggesting you wear one.  She supports the decision to wear one.
Two different mindsets.

@dansoto A suggestion is a mere suggestion. The rules are workplace regulations.  They exist to protect workers from exploitative bosses who would put their health in danger for profit.  That is what the city (never really invested in protecting workers anyway) is retreating from

@skooks I have no clue how you twisted this but that is not what she said. She said she supports people's rights to continue wearing one, not that she suggests wearing one.
Her words were chosen carefully.
